comment.author: 33910171@N05
comment._content:
The stone was laid by a relative of relative of mine.

The stone is still visible in the concourse at Central and the person laying the stone was "John See". I believe that he was Premier of NSW at the time - probably needs someone to zoom into the photo better or read the actual stone.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It was the laying of the foundation stone of the Central Station Tower. Read all about it - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/10574321 . The foundation stone for the new station was laid on 30/4/1902 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14452292

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/baldy_mcspecs] You're right, it was John See. I have added a note over the stone after viewing a higher res. And I've added a larger version above.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for the link to the ceremony.

AB
